Between-GMM Discrepancy : Jensen-Renyi Divergence

Source: R/gmm_gmmdistJR.R
gmmdistJR.Rd

Between-GMM Discrepancy : Jensen-Renyi Divergence

gmmdistJR(gmmobj1, gmmobj2)

References

Wang F, Syeda-Mahmood T, Vemuri BC, Beymer D, Rangarajan A (2009). “Closed-Form Jensen-Renyi Divergence for Mixture of Gaussians and Applications to Group-Wise Shape Registration.” In Medical Image Computing and Computer-Assisted Intervention - MICCAI 2009, volume 5761, 648--655. Springer Berlin Heidelberg. ISBN 978-3-642-04267-6 978-3-642-04268-3, doi: 10.1007/978-3-642-04268-3_80 .

Examples

# \donttest{
# -------------------------------------------------------------
#                   Distance for Gaussian Mixtures
#
# Data 1 : use SMILEY data 'gensmiley()' function.
# Data 2 : SMILEY data is rotated (rot).
# Data 3 : SMILEY data is translated (gap) and rotated (rot).
# -------------------------------------------------------------
## GENERATE DATA
#  set up
ndata = 10
ntot  = 3*ndata
gap   = 10
rot   = qr.Q(qr(matrix(rnorm(4),ncol=2)))

#  generate
list_data = list()
for (i in 1:ndata){
  list_data[[i]]           = (gensmiley(n=150, sd=0.1)$data)
  list_data[[i+ndata]]     = (gensmiley(n=150, sd=0.1)$data)%*%rot
  list_data[[i+(2*ndata)]] = (gensmiley(n=150, sd=0.1)$data)%*%rot + gap
}


## FIT GMM MODELS WITH K=4
list_gmm = list()
for (i in 1:ntot){
  list_gmm[[i]] = gmm(list_data[[i]], k=4)
}

## COMPUTE PAIRWISE DISTANCE
distJR = array(0,c(ntot,ntot))
for (i in 1:(ntot-1)){
  gi = list_gmm[[i]]
  for (j in (i+1):ntot){
    gj = list_gmm[[j]]
    distJR[i,j] <- distJR[j,i] <- gmmdistJR(gi, gj)
  }
}

## VISUALIZE
opar <- par(no.readonly=TRUE)
par(mfrow=c(1,2), pty="s")
plot(list_data[[1]], main="SMILEY data", pch=19)
image(distJR[,ntot:1], axes=FALSE, col=gray((0:64)/64),
      main="Jensen-Renyi Divergence")

par(opar)
# }
